title: Venomous Animals
description: Learn about the world's most venomous creatures, from snakes and spiders to jellyfish and frogs.

questions.question: What is the difference between venomous and poisonous animals?
options: Venomous animals inject toxins; poisonous ones are harmful when eaten or touched

questions.question: Which spider, recognized by the red hourglass on its abdomen, is one of the most venomous in North America?
The king cobra is the world's longest venomous snake. How long can it grow?
Which tiny octopus, found in tide pools of Australia, has venom that can kill a human?
The box jellyfish is considered one of the most venomous marine animals. Where is it commonly found?
Which venomous lizard is native to the southwestern United States?
The stonefish, the world's most venomous fish, is dangerous because of what?
options: Venomous spines on its dorsal fin

questions.question: Which African snake is known for 'spitting' venom at the eyes of its predators?
The cone snail delivers venom through what mechanism?
Which scorpion is considered the most dangerous to humans?
The Brazilian wandering spider is considered dangerous because it does what?
options: Actively wanders rather than building webs

questions.question: Antivenin (antivenom) is typically produced using what method?
options: Injecting small amounts of venom into horses and harvesting antibodies

questions.question: The duck-billed platypus is one of the few venomous mammals. Where is its venom delivered from?
Which venomous snake is responsible for the most snakebite deaths in India?
The Portuguese man-of-war looks like a jellyfish but is actually what?
options: A colony of organisms called a siphonophore
